name: Hellsplit: Arena

reviews:
I've now played both B&S, and Hellsplit Arena. And my Official opinion is the following

The Modding Department of B&S is definitely by far superior. Although the combat of the game severely lacks any sort of challenge. It's violence is also rather lacking without mods imo.

With that said, Comparing it to something like Hellsplit, The violence in this game is insanely good. Dismembering has alot more options as well in comparison to B&S. The Combat is very Progressive and the AI actually reacts reasonably to whatever you do (for the most part).

Now what i really do not like as of right now, is the fact that you cannot use Mods in the campaign itself. That is a very huge flaw in my honest opinion. i really wish, and also hope that the Devs will make it so that Mods are available during the normal campaign as well. This is something that has kept me in B&S for a very long time, the sheer amount of possibilities and mods i was able to use even during the crystal hunt mode (which is technically the Campaign of B&S now) is just simply incredible.

i sadly do not feel the same with HSA. Due to it's very much lacking mod department for the Campaign itself, i feel like it'll get boring extremely quickly once you're done with the hard mode as well. unless of course you don't mind replaying the same game over and over again but with absolutely 0 changes outside of the challenges you may give yourself.

This game has some insane Potential to Rival B&S, if not even Surpassing it in almost every way! Just please, let me use the mods in the campaign. that alone would make me stay much longer than i have right now.

with all that said, my complete Rating for the game is : 7.5/10. 
The game Itself is a 10/10, but with no Mods in Campaign, sadly that reduces it by a 2.5.

Definitely worth buying even without a discount, but it still needs some overall improvements here and there. Which i hope they'll do in the future.
Pretty fun, skeletons as an enemy are kind of boring to fight though.

Good game my type with the gore. The gore is a pretty good feature of the game especially with ripping heads off and ripping out hearts, and the details of the ripped off limbs, and heads, its all great but cant wait for more customization for PCVR. I personally enjoy when there are lots of different types of accessories and clothing, and since there are supposed to be many customization options soon so I'm pretty excited for 1.3. (side note I'm talking about customizing the character with tattoos changing hair that stuff) In my personal opinion it is worth it and if you're like me def worth it when customization happens.

i refunded this about a year ago but ive decided to give it another try. The mod support is a game changer. i played resident evil 4, silent hill, lived as batman. and dont forget how beautifully full fledged the combat is. the best feeling melee in any vr game hands down.
Such an amazing game absolutely incredible and really fun!
